Here are some of the remarkable features of Barnes & Noble Classics: New introductions commissioned from todays top writers and scholars Biographies of the authors Chronologies of contemporary historical, biographical, and cultural events Footnotes and endnotes Selective discussions of imitations, parodies, poems, books, plays, paintings, operas, statuary, and films inspired by the work Comments by other famous authors Study questions to challenge the readers viewpoints and expec...

title: Thus Spake the Corpse
subject: American literature -- 20th century, California -- Imprints, Essays, Poetry -- Collections, Poetry, Modern -- 20th century
description: Andrei Codrescu's infamous anti-literary magazine Exquisite Corpse became a prime site of engaged dialogue in the stormy decade of its existence. Taking its name from Surrealism, the Corpse became the home of rebellion, passion, polemic, black humor, sedition, and all points between the front lines and back alleys of contemporary culture. In this text, Codrescu and Rosenthal resurrect the best essays and poems from Carl Rakosi, James Purdy, Joel Oppenheimer, Robert Creeley, Tom Clark and other members of America's vibrant and eclectic avant-garde.

title: Les Miserables
author: Victor Hugo
subject: Juvenile Fiction / Classics, more
characters: Jean Valjean, Cosette, Fantine, Inspector Javert, Gavroche, Éponine, Marius Pontmercy, Enjolras, Bishop Myriel, Thenardier, Grantaire, Courfeyrac, Azelma, Madame Thénardier, Bienvenu Myriel, Champmathieu, Madame Baptistine, Bamatabois, Chenildieu, Toussaint
description: The classic novel--and hit Broadway show--about escaped convict Jean Valjean and young orphan Cosette is now a Bullseye Step into Classics title. Featuring easy-to-read text, big type, and short chapters, this engaging adaptation of a timeless tale is ideal for reluctant readers and kids not yet ready to tackle the original.

title: Super Special 01
description: After thirteen books, Abby is finally graduating from fifth grade. There's a lot to do before the big event, including finding the perfect graduation outfit. Once the ceremony is over, Abby plans to spend a quiet summer preparing for sixth grade. Then Abby's mother college friend, Laurie, and her young daughter, Wynter, arrive for an extended stay. Laurie--a musician--is trying to get her career back on track. She expects Abby to care for Wynter while she's out. Before long, Abby gets fed up. Abby's mom confronts Laurie, and Abby is able to reclaim her pre-middle school summer.
sub_title: The Best Is Yet to Come

title: Sachs and Violens
author: David Peter, Peter Allen David, George Perez
subject: Comic books, strips, etc, Sex -- Comic books, strips, etc, Violence -- Comic books, strips, etc
description: The brutal killing of a young actress during the shooting of a snuff film sets soft core model Juanita Jean Sachs and photographer Ernie Schultz on a quest to discover those responsible. Their journey takes them from the mean streets of New York to the back alleys of New Orleans where they confront the utter depravity and corruption that defines the dark underbelly of American society. But they discover something else. Somehing unexpected. Their destiny.

title: Nicomachean ethics
author: Aristotle, Joe Sachs
subject: Ethics, Aristotle -- Contributions In Ethics
description:
Focus Philosophical Library's edition of Aristotle's Nicomachean Ethics is a lucid and useful translation of one of Aristotle's major works for the student of undergraduate philosophy, as well as for the general reader interested in the major works of western civilization. This edition includes notes and a glossary, intending to provide the reader with some sense of the terms and the concepts as they were understood by Aristotle's immediate audience.
Focus Philosophical Library books are distinguished by their commitment to faithful, clear, and consistent translations of texts and the rich world part and parcel of those texts.

title: His Dark Materials
author: Philip Pullman
subject: English drama -- 21st century
description: "Lyra and Will find themselves embarked on a thrilling journey through worlds familiar and unknown. Their great quest demands a savage struggle against the most dangerous of enemies. They encounter fantastical creatures in parallel worlds - rebellious angels, soul-eating Spectres, child-catching Gobblers and the armoured bears and witch-clans of the Arctic. Finally, before reaching, perhaps, the Republic of Heaven, they must visit the Land of the Dead ..." "Adapted from Philip Pullman's three novels into two full-length plays, Nicholas Wright's stage version of His Dark Materials was a triumph when premiered at the National Theatre in a production directed by Nicholas Hytner. Published here is the revised text prepared when the plays were re-staged by popular demand the following year."--BOOK JACKET.

title: Lucie Babbidge's House
author: Sylvia Cassedy
subject: Juvenile Fiction / Family / Orphans & Foster Homes, Juvenile Fiction / General, Dolls -- Juvenile fiction, Emotional problems -- Juvenile Fiction, Orphans -- Juvenile fiction
description: Lonely and unhappy Lucie is bullied at school and struggles to fit in. The arrival of a new baby brings some happiness to Lucie, and when she receives some letters from a girl in England, a mystery begins to unfold as Lucy realizes their lives are connected.

title: Peony in Love
author: Lisa See
genres: Novel, Historical Fiction, Romance novel, Ghost story
subject: Fiction / Historical / General, American fiction -- 21st century, China -- Fiction -- History -- Ming dynasty, 1368-1644, Fiction / Literary, Fiction / Psychological, Future life -- Fiction, Lovesickness -- Fiction, Opera -- Fiction, Operas, Chinese -- Fiction, Women -- Fiction -- China, Young women -- Fiction -- China
description:
“I finally understand what the poets have written. In spring, moved to passion; in autumn only regret.”

For young Peony, betrothed to a suitor she has never met, these lyrics from The Peony Pavilion mirror her own longings. In the garden of the Chen Family Villa, amid the scent of ginger, green tea, and jasmine, a small theatrical troupe is performing scenes from this epic opera, a live spectacle few females have ever seen. Like the heroine in the drama, Peony is the cloistered daughter of a wealthy family, trapped like a good-luck cricket in a bamboo-and-lacquer cage. Though raised to be obedient, Peony has dreams of her own.

Peony’s mother is against her daughter’s attending the production: “Unmarried girls should not be seen in public.” But Peony’s father assures hi...

title: The Stuffed Owl
subject: Humor / Form / Limericks & Verse, Poetry / Anthologies (multiple authors), Poetry / European / General, American poetry, Bathetic poetry, American, Bathetic poetry, English, Bathetic poetry, Scottish, English poetry, Poetry / European / English, Irish, Scottish, Welsh
description: The editors of this legendary and hilarious anthology write: "It would seem at a hasty glance that to make an anthology of Bad Verse is on the whole a simple matter . . . On the contrary . . . Bad Verse has its canons, like Good Verse. There is bad Bad Verse and good Bad Verse. It has been the constant preoccupation of the compilers to include in this book chiefiy good Bad Verse." Here indeed one finds the best of the worst of the greatest poets of the English language, masterpieces of the maladroit by Dryden, Wordsworth, and Keats, among many others, together with an index ("Maiden, feathered, uncontrolled appetites of, 59;. . . Manure, adjudged a fit subject for the Muse, 91") that is itself an inspired work of folly.

title: Blue at the Mizzen (Vol. Book 20) (Aubrey/Maturin Novels)
author: Patrick O'Brian
genres: Historical Fiction, historical novel, Nautical fiction
subject: Fiction / Action & Adventure, Fiction / Historical / General, Fiction / Sea Stories, Chile -- Fiction -- History -- War of Independence, 1810-1824, Great Britain -- Fiction -- History, Naval -- 19th century, Sea stories, Aubrey, Jack (Fictitious character) -- Fiction, Maturin, Stephen (Fictitious character) -- Fiction, War stories
description:
"The old master has us again in the palm of his hand." —Los Angeles Times
Napoleon has been defeated at Waterloo, and the ensuing peace brings with it both the desertion of nearly half of Captain Aubrey's crew and the sudden dimming of Aubrey's career prospects in a peacetime navy. When the Surprise is nearly sunk on her way to South America—where Aubrey and Stephen Maturin are to help Chile assert her independence from Spain—the delay occasioned by repairs reaps a harvest of strange consequences. The South American expedition is a desperate affair; and in the end Jack's bold initiative to strike at the vastly superior Spanish fleet precipitates a spectacular naval action that will determine both Chile's fate and his own.

title: All Around the Town
author: Herbert Asbury
subject: History / Military / Revolutions & Wars of Independence, History / United States / State & Local / General, New York (N.Y.) -- Anecdotes -- Social conditions, New York (N.Y.) -- History
description: The author of the New York Times best-seller The Gangs of New York returns with a second volume of tales from Gotham's underworld. In this wonderfully colorful and surprising history, Herbert Asbury expands his purview beyond the Five Corners to the entire city of New York. From Lord Cornbury, a loonily corrupt, cross-dressing British governor of colonial days, to the Broadway pickpocket who built herself a mansion in Hoboken, where she set herself up as European royalty, to prohibitionist Carry Nation's first visit to a scornful city of saloons (and her memorable confrontation with the drunken John L. Sullivan), All Around the Town brings to vivid life a memorable range of characters, grifters, murderers, and madmen. Rediscovering a fascinating array of lost corners in the history of t...
sub_title: Murder, Scandal, Riot and Mayhem in Old New York

title: Candide ou L'optimisme
author: Voltaire, Michelle Béguin, Jean Goldzink
subject: Adventure stories
description: " Qu'est-ce qu'optimisme ? disait Cacambo. - Hélas ! dit Candide, c'est la rage de soutenir que tout est bien quand on est mal ". L'œuvre la plus célèbre de voltaire, un des textes français les plus universellement connus, démontre trois choses : que le monde va mal, et qu'il pourrait aller mieux, si l'on commençait par dire moins de bêtises. En attendant, mieux vaut rire que pleurer, tout en cultivant notre jardin. Candide conjugue la philosophie et le comique.

title: The Story of Scotland
author: Nigel G. Tranter
subject: Scotland -- History -- Civilization, Scotland -- History, Scotland -- History -- History, Military
description: Nigel Tranter expertly weaves the colorful threads of folklore into the fabric of historical fact. The legends, myths, stories and memories handed down from generation to generation are added to the bare bones of factual record to reveal Scotland's true character.

title: From Glencoe to Stirling : Rob Roy, the Highlanders & Scotland's chivalric age
author: Walter Scott
subject: History / Europe / Great Britain / General, Jacobite Rebellion, 1745-1746, Scotland -- History -- To 1603, Scotland -- History, Scotland -- History -- 1689-1645
description: The third quarter of the classic volume written by Scott, Tales of a Grandfather, covering the history of Scotland up to Scott's time.

title: The dance of the dissident daughter
author: Sue Monk Kidd
subject: Body, Mind & Spirit / Spirituality / General, Religion / Christian Living / Spiritual Growth, Religion / Spirituality, Feminism, Feminism -- Religious aspects, Feminist theology, Feminists -- Biography -- United States, Religion -- Spirituality, Spiritual biography, Spiritual biography -- United States, Feminism -- Biography -- United States -- Religious aspects, Feminists -- Biography, Kidd, Sue Monk
description:
The acclaimed spiritual memoir from the author of The Secret Life of Bees
I was amazed to find that I had no idea how to unfold my spiritual life in a feminine way. I was surprised and, in fact, a little terrified when I found myself in the middle of a feminist spiritual reawakening.
Sue Monk was a "conventionally religious, churchgoing woman, a traditional wife and mother" with a thriving career as a Christian writer until she began to question her role as a woman in her culture, her family, and her church. From a jarring encounter with sexism in a suburban drugstore to monastery retreats and rituals in the caves of Crete, Kidd takes readers through the fear, anger, healing, and transformation of her awakening. Retaining a meaningful connection "with the deep song of...

title: The High King
author: Lloyd Alexander
subject: Juvenile Fiction / Action & Adventure / General, more
awards: John Newbery Medal
nominations: John Newbery Medal, National Book Award for Children's Books, National Book Award for Children’s Books (Fiction, Paperback)
characters: Taran, Gurgi, Fflewddur Fflam, Princess Eilonwy, Doli
description:
The High King by Lloyd Alexander

When the most powerful weapon in the land of Prydain falls into the hands of Arawn, Lord of the Land of Death, Taran and Prince Gwydion rally an army to stand up to the dark forces.

The companions' last and greatest quest is also their most perilous. The biting cold of winter is upon them, adding to the danger they already face. Their journey, fraught with battle and bloodshed, ends at the very portal of Arawn's stronghold. There, Taran is faced with the most crucial decision of his life.

In this breathtaking Newbery Medal-winning conclusion to The Chronicles of Prydain, the faithful friends face the ultimate war between good and evil.

title: House of Leaves
author: Mark Z. Danielewski
genres: Novel, Horror fiction, Ergodic literature, Satire, Experimental literature, Romance novel, Chivalric romance, Paranormal fiction
subject: American fiction -- 20th century, Experimental fiction, Horror tales
nominations: Guardian First Book Award, Locus Award for Best First Novel
description: Johnny Truant, an employee in a LA tattoo parlour, finds a notebook kept by Zampano, a reclusive old man found dead in a cluttered apartment. Herein is the heavily annotated story of the Navidson Report. Will Navidson, a photojournalist, and his family move into a new house. What happens next is recorded on videotapes and in interviews.

title: The Sot-weed Factor
author: John Barth
subject: English -- Fiction -- Maryland, Maryland -- Fiction -- History -- Colonial period, ca.1600-1775, Poets -- Fiction -- Marylandx, Tobaco industry -- Fiction -- Maryland, Vices -- Fiction, English fiction -- Maryland, Poets -- Fiction, Tobacco industry -- Fiction -- Maryland
description: Recounts the wildly chaotic odyssey of hapless, ungainly Ebenezer Cooke, sent to the New World to look after his father's tobacco business. The book is a tribute to the most insidious human vices and a hilarious ride through the 18th century in the company of heroes, villans, innocents and rogues.

title: Narcisse et Goldmund
author: Hermann Hesse
subject: Historical fiction
description: Roman philosophique. Roman psychologique (formation).

title: La Conjura De Los Necios
author: John Kennedy Toole
